OSU Extension CMS Developer Documentation


This site contains documentation and information for web developers. If you are a content creator, please see the 
main CMS documentation
.

docs.text:
Local Environment Setup


You will need to do a number of things, including:




Homebrew


Blt


Drush (aliases)
docs.title: Local Environment Setup

docs.text: You will need to do a number of things, including:   Homebrew  Blt  Drush (aliases)
docs.title: Local Environment Setup

docs.text:
Git Repository Location


The code repository for the CMS is located on Github: 
https://github.com/osu-eesc/extd8


Branching strategy


We have not yet discussed a branching strategy, but when we do, it will be described here.


Coding Style requirements


All code committed to the extd8 repository must meet all 
Drupal coding standards
.


Commit Message requirements


All commits to the extd8 repository must have commit messages that meet the following requirements:




Start with a JIRA ticket number followed by a colon (:) and a space (e.g. "ABC-123: ")


Contain an explanatory message that starts with a capital letter.


End with a period (.)




See this A List Apart article for tips on writing useful commit messages: 
The Art of the Commit
.
docs.title: Source Control

docs.title: Deployment

docs.text:
Full MkDocs Documentation


For full documentation visit 
mkdocs.org
.


Installation




Clone the documentation Git repository from 
https://github.com/osu-eesc/cms


With HomeBrew installed, run 
brew install mkdocs




Making Updates




Navigate to the folder in the documentation site containing mkdocs.yml


Run 
mkdocs serve


As you make changes to documentation pages, a live preview will be available at 
http://127.0.0.1:8000/




Building and Deploying the Documentation Site


After writing updates to the documentation,




Navigate to the folder in the documentation site containing mkdocs.yml


Run 
mkdocs build --clean


Commit and push all changes
docs.title: Maintaining Documentation
